description: Also known as the Queen of Bavaria Conure, this is an exceptionally beautiful and rare parrot. They are a stunning, uniform bright yellow, with green flight feathers.
temperament: Extremely intelligent, playful, curious, and affectionate. They are very social birds that require a huge amount of attention and interaction to thrive.
loudness: Very Loud. They have a loud, harsh call that they will use frequently, especially if they are not the center of attention.
vocalization: Can be good talkers, but are more known for their loud natural calls. Their intelligence makes them great at learning tricks.
dietaryNeeds: A formulated diet is the base, but they require a wide variety of other foods, including vegetables, fruits, and some nuts.
healthPointers: Can live for about 30 years. Due to their rarity, they are very expensive and require specialized care. They are susceptible to Conure Bleeding Syndrome.
housing: Unsuitable for apartments. They need a very large and durable cage or aviary to accommodate their high energy levels. Minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48"H.
